Description: Border with the four Evangelists (in the corners in circles) and twelve scenes for the life of Christ (in ovals). From top left corner, clockwise: St Luke with bull, the annunciation, the resurrection of Christ, St Mark with a winged lion, Christ on the Mount of Olives, Christ on the cross, Christ before Pilate, Christ before Caiaphas, St John with an eagle, the last supper, multiplication of the loaves and fish, St Matthew with an angel, the circumcision of Christ, the baptism of Christ, the adoration of the Magi and the nativity; letterpress in black and red in centre of border and on verso; after Pieter van den Borcht; illustration to 'Missale Romanum' (Antwerp, 1574) Woodcut from sixteen separate woodblocks
Producer name: Print made by: Antoine van Leest
Curator's comments: For a similar border see 1895,1031.986. The order of some of the images has been changed. Two images (Christ among the doctors and flight into Egypt) have been replaced by two other scenes (circumcision of christ and adoration of the Magi).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (11)
New Hollstein (Dutch & Flemish) / The New Hollstein: Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts 1450-1700 (522-537; 539-542) (variant; after Pieter van den Borcht)
Associated titles: (published in Antwerp in 1574 by Christoph Plantin)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
